name: Kernel Staked ETH
description: ksETH is mintable against any LSTs that are restakable on Karak. Users can deposit their LSTs onto Kernel Protocol, where they will be restaked on Karak and then the user will be given an equivalent quantity of ksETH tokens, representing their Karak-restaked holdings. ksETH using any approved LST as collateral. Simply connect your wallet, select the asset you wish to mint with, input the amount and press “Mint”. In return you’ll receive an equivalent quantity of ksETH to deploy in further yield-bearing DeFi activities. Whilst your assets are restaked you’ll be earning Kernel Points and Karak XP in the background.
